p: Crucially, the AHL is linked to an epidemiological approach based on risk backed by scientific evidence that will be more dynamic. Changing and evolving as necessary, this law will provide appropriate margins of flexibility by enabling the modification of any action when new evidence emerges. The AHL allows preventive actions to be timely and more effective in the control of endemic diseases within the EU and, importantly, to exotic epizootics coming from third world countries. This will allow specific rules to be applied when confronted with new diseases. In addition to the areas already under the current legislation, specific areas of interest are regulated for the first time, such as responsibility for animal health, biosafety, epidemiological investigations, surveillance, and applications of a disease-free status.
